data.title: grammar-used activation hook regression
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)? **N/A**
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

My package has a `grammar-used` activation hook, as per #8313 it is triggered on opening a new file but not on opening a previous session.

I have observed this working correctly at some point in an earlier version, but can't say how long ago.
### Steps to Reproduce

(as per #8313)
1. Install language-purescript and ide-purescript
2. Open a file with `.purs` extension - observe package starts
3. Close atom
4. Re-open atom (so file is still open)

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
-  Package is started

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
-  Package does not start
-  Package can be observed to neither be started nor activated (via console.log on startup)
-  Opening a new file which was not already open will start the package as normal (but not switching to one of the existing files)
### Versions

apm 1.10.0
atom 1.9.4 (also verified on 1.10.0-beta1)

OSX 10.9.4

please fix this bug, ths :)

data.title: Open Folder instead opens Chrome Inspector
data.body:
### Description

When using the Open Folder feature, upon selecting a folder, the Chrome Inspector is opened instead. This is also affecting the Project Manager plugin, which ultimately uses folders.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. File -> Open Folder
2. Select a folder and choose "Select Folder"
3. Inspector is opened.

Expected at step 3: Atom is opened in the selected folder context.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.9.3
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

data.title: "New Window" opens DOM browser
data.body: Atom 1.9.3 on Macintosh, when I select "New Window" from the menu bar, hot key, or from the Dock menu, the DOM browser window opens.

data.title: Opening a new window from the shortcut or file menu opens the dev tools window.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

The dev tools opens when a new window should in 1.9.3 on the PC. It works fine if I roll back to 1.9.2.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom.
2. Click file, "New Window" or the key binding for it.
3. Watch it open the dev tools.

**Expected behavior:** Open a new window.

**Actual behavior:** Opens the dev tools window.
### Version: 1.9.3

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'PWD' of null
data.body:
**Steps**
1. Initial launch of Atom application
2. Selected 'Open a Project' from the Welcome Guide
3. Selected to open a directory from `~/Sites/` before the following error was displayed in Atom

**Atom Version**: 1.9.3
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.6
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'PWD' of null

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/update-process-env.js:13

TypeError: Cannot read property 'PWD' of null
    at updateProcessEnv (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/update-process-env.js:13:16)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/initialize-application-window.js:41:16)
    at emitTwo (events.js:100:13)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:185:7)
```

{

}

data.title: Handle double-click on custom title bar
data.body:
Unlike the native version, the custom title bar implemented in #11790 doesn't respond to double-clicks. This pull request implements the double-click behaviour in a manner that is consistent with the native title bar.

This is my first contribution to Atom, and the first time I've written CoffeeScript. I'd be grateful for feedback if there's something I ought to have done differently.

In case this pull request should include a test, I would appreciate some help in putting it together 🙂

data.title: Fix decorated layer destruction
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12111

data.title: Cant Install ATOM
data.body:
### Description

I am unable to install the latest version of ATOM. I tried download it directly from the website (the main download button on the front page). I have ran it as administrator. I have had atom on my PC since the beginning. I just realized though that its not in my list of installed programs. Github's windows client has a new ATOM button that doesn't appear (because atom i believe is not installed correctly) How can I install it correctly or fix my current installation. I do have the [SquirrelStetup.log](http://theaamgroup.com/hosting/SquirrelSetup.log)

I have removed all traces of ATOM.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. I downloaded ATOM
2. I run in Administrator Mode or Normal Mode
3. It starts (the atom rocket is being loaded)
4. It fails after about 5 seconds saying installation has failed and to check the log file.
5. I don't see a problem in the log file but I'm not sure what to look for.

**Expected behavior:** ATOM to be installed correctly

**Actual behavior:** It fails to install
### Versions

WINDOWS 10
[SquirrelSetup.txt](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/402257/SquirrelSetup.txt)

data.title: Folding level 2 unfolds level 1
data.body: I often want to fold the code, then expand a single class and fold its second level (eg. in Python or C++). But when I do `CTRL+K CTRL+2` after `CTRL+K CTRL+1`, the first level is all expanded again.

data.title: Atom.io & Sublime Text 3 not displaying Japanese characters?
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom nor Sublime display Japanese characters properly to me. I've tried changing to Fonts in File>Settings to some Japanese fonts I have installed, such as `Meiryo and MS Mincho Regular`, I am on Windows 10, and have installed added Japanese language packs, yet the problem still persists
### Versions

 1.9.2

![8f615d9b](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10796670/17397702/e0562906-5a6b-11e6-8c43-035f240f6f9a.png)

data.body: Broken lines in editor Atom 1.9.2

data.title: Git status coloring in tree view disappears - 1.9 OSX
data.body:
Title is self explanatory. I can replicate by:
1. Open Atom in safe mode
2. Add a project which you know to have changes. Git status coloring usually appears fine at this point.
3. Switch focus to another app, then back to Atom and you can _see_ the colours disappear back to the normal default colours.

El Capitan 10.11.4

Atom    : 1.9.0
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

data.title: Parts of window dont render / appear black
data.body:
Hey,
im working on a rather small js document and parts of the entire window dont render/appear black until i either scroll, refresh this part or move the mouse cursor over the area.

Working on Atom 1.9.2 on OSX 10.9.5. Safe mode shows the same issue, other files/file types as well.

Screenshot attached.

Thanks!
M

data.title: Python syntax highlighting parsing breaks for some comments
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Python syntax highlighting fails to "close" a Python triple-quote `'''` comment, breaking the rest of the file's syntax highlighting. This occurs on all of the highlighting styles installed by default on Windows and occurs when atom is started in safe mode or when started with a cleared window state.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/602444/17385803/14df4aae-59b3-11e6-84a8-3f62e29f2bf2.PNG)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [Download file](https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/2016.3/salt/modules/file.py) and open in Atom
2. Go to line 1485

**Expected behavior:** Line 1485 should be highlighted as a line of code

**Actual behavior:** Line 1485 and onward are highlighted as a comment
### Versions

OS: Windows 10

```
Atom    : 1.9.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git
visual studio
```

data.title: Don't update the NODE_PATH when updating the environment on launch
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12313
Fixes https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/205
Refs https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12006 (solves same problem, but with a different approach)

Both `NODE_ENV` and `NODE_PATH` affect Atom's own behavior, so when loading environment variables from the main process, Atom needs to control these two variables explicitly.

data.title: Merge "Install" section with "Packages" section
data.body:
I can't count anymore how many times I've wanted to install a new package, went to settings, clicked "Packages" and started to type the package name in the search box waiting and staring at the screen while nothing happened...

The two interfaces "Packages" and "Install" are so similar that it's really hard to keep the two apart. Why don't we merge them into one, called "Packages" to avoid confusion?

To me it seems intuitive that if you want to install "packages" you go and click on "packages" first, especially since that's the first item that you see when you're scanning the menu options from top to bottom.

Even adding a "install new packages" button in the "packages" section linking to the "install" section would help tremendously I think.

data.title: Windows 10 1607 Build 14393.10 - "Open with Atom" doesn't work
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I updated to the Win10 Anniversary Build today and wanted to edit some files, but whenever I select the specific option in the context menu (right-click), Windows asks me which program I should use to open the specific file with.

I also reinstalled Atom already, just to be safe.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Have Windows 10 1607 Build 14393.10 (Pretty much the anniversary build)
2. Try to rightclick any file and select "Open with Atom"

**Expected behavior:** Open the specific file in Atom

**Actual behavior:** Windows asks me with what program I want to open the file
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

Atom    : 1.10.0-beta1
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

Windows 10 1607 Build 14393.10

data.title: Cursor keeps switching back to pointer instead of i beam
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

The cursor keeps switching back to a pointer instead of an i beam.

[![https://gyazo.com/86f19cdd229d3db894a327cfeb6eee80](https://i.gyazo.com/86f19cdd229d3db894a327cfeb6eee80.gif)](https://gyazo.com/86f19cdd229d3db894a327cfeb6eee80)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Focus away from atom window
2. Bring atom window into focus
3. Click on a few lines of text
4. Watch the cursor revert to a pointer

**Expected behavior:** The cursor should remain an i beam

**Actual behavior:** The cursor reverted to a pointer
### Versions

1.9.2 | 1.9.3 | 1.9.4
### Additional Info

OS: OS X El Capitan: 10.11.6
Syntax and UI Theme: Atom One Dark

Moving the cursor to the sidebar and back to the editor temporarily fixes the problem.

data.title: Atom Beta 1.10.beta1 : Indexing Project never completes.
data.body:
Since the release this morning 08/03/2016 when trying to search files with `ctrl + p` Atom indexing never finishes and files are not found. Always says 0 and indexing project.
I believe this is related to the `fuzzy-finder` package.

data.title: Open Intergrated Terminal Crash on None-English Folder
data.body:
- Atom Version:1.9.1
- OS Version:Windows 10Pro x64 14393 and Windows 10Ent x64 10240

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a folder with a None-English Name,for instance, "你好世界helloWorld"
2. Right click on this folder and open with Atom.
   3.Install `platformio-atom-ide-terminal`
3. Press `Ctrl +`` and Terminal Crash(with blank content) with exit code 1.
   Same error in vscode which is also Electron-based.
   The Error Code   in Atom  as following:

`C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\src\task.js:52 Unable to start terminal process. Win32 error code: 267 Error: Unable to start terminal process. Win32 error code: 267
at Error (native)
at Server. (C:\Users\mzvast.atom\packages\platformio-ide-terminal\node_modules\pty.js\lib\pty_win.js:67:9)
at emitOne (events.js:90:13)
at Server.emit (events.js:182:7)
at Pipe.onconnection (net.js:1439:8)
(anonymous function) @C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\src\task.js:52
(anonymous function) @C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\src\task.js:126
module.exports.Emitter.simpleDispatch @ C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\node_modules\event-kit\lib\emitter.…:25
module.exports.Emitter.emit @ C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\node_modules\event-kit\lib\emitter.…:125
(anonymous function) @ C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\src\task.js:78emitTwo @ events.js:100
emit @ events.js:185
handleMessage @ internal/child_process.js:718
channel.onread @ internal/child_process.js:444`

The win32 error code 267 seem to be,according to [microsoft:](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms681382%28v=vs.85%29.aspx)

```
ERROR_DIRECTORY
267 (0x10B)
The directory name is invalid.
```

data.title: Update page doesn't show newest release version and notes
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)? _This only happens when there's a new release._
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? _This happens just before updating to the latest version._
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? _I didn't get the chance to before this happened._
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? _Yes._
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? _I'm fairly certain this is the correct repository, since it has to do with the core updater (or maybe just the About/update tab)._
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? _Yes._

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

The atom updater, when there's a new update, always shows the currently-installed vesion.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Wait until there's a new release
2. Click the Squirrel icon in the lower-right

**Expected behavior:**

The Restart & Update section on the About tab should show the newest release version and link to its notes.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

The Restart & Update section shows the _currently-installed_ version number and links to the _currently-installed_ version's release notes.

![atom-updater-wrong_version_and_notes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5084820/17374133/2e1af480-5979-11e6-9e6f-222d19aecd17.png)
### Versions

Windows version

```
ver
Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.10586]
```

Atom version

```
atom --version
Atom: 1.9.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome: 49.0.2623.75
Node: 5.10.0
```

Atom package manager version

```
apm --version
apm: 1.10.0
npm: 2.13.3
node: 0.10.40
python
git
Visual Studio
```

Since I'm on Windows, the `apm --version` colors may not be displaying correctly. I had a hard time reading the Node version output for that command.

Also, as far as I know, this has been happening at least since Atom 1.5 or 1.6. I just didn't think to report it until now.

data.title: Atom update to 1.9 Restart and Install (with admin privileges) does not work
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?

- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I am having the same problem described in the two threads mentioned below, but I have admin rights. Also, there is no "Restart and install" button anywhere on the 'About' page.

https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12072
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2860

Here's the console (the shipit lines repeat continually):

```
8/3/16 10:57:25.452 AM Atom[81604]: Download completed to: file:///Users/name/Library/Application%20Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt/update.H8PaFW2/atom-mac.zip
8/3/16 10:57:27.071 AM com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (com.github.atom.ShipIt[82050]) Service exited with abnormal code: 1
8/3/16 10:57:27.071 AM com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (com.github.atom.ShipIt) Service only ran for 0 seconds. Pushing respawn out by 2 seconds.
8/3/16 10:57:29.091 AM com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (com.github.atom.ShipIt[82052]) Service exited with abnormal code: 1
8/3/16 10:57:29.091 AM com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (com.github.atom.ShipIt) Service only ran for 0 seconds. Pushing respawn out by 2 seconds.
```

And the shipit stderr output in `Users/name/Library/Application%20Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt`:

```
2016-08-03 11:08:11.385 ShipIt[82643:1574792] ShipIt quitting
2016-08-03 11:08:13.409 ShipIt[82644:1574817] Installation error: Error Domain=SQRLShipItRequestErrorDomain Code=2 "Could not read update request" UserInfo={NSLocalizedDescription=Could not read update request, NSUnderlyingError=0x7faea9f00a10 {Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=260 "The file “ShipItState.plist” couldn’t be opened because there is no such file." UserInfo={NSFilePath=/var/root/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt/ShipItState.plist, NSUnderlyingError=0x7faea9f00210 {Error Domain=NSPOSIXErrorDomain Code=2 "No such file or directory"}}}}
```

But ShipItState.plist exists in the same folder.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open up atom 1.8, which opens a new atom helper install dialog.
2. Enter password into the dialog and click 'OK'.
3. Go to Atom > Restart and Install.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Atom closes, updates, and restarts into 1.9.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Atom closes, does not restart, and has not changed from 1.8 upon re-opening.
### Versions

OSX 10.11.4

$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

### Versions

data.title: Buffer marker doesn’t create editor marker anymore
data.body:
Prior v1.9 release, when I create a buffer marker it was also available as editor’s `DisplayMarker`. Example:
1. Get `TextEditor` instance (let’s call it `editor`)
2. Add buffer marker: `editor.getBuffer().markRange([[0, 1], [0, 2]])`
3. Check buffer markers: `editor.getBuffer().getMarkers()` returns `[Marker]`
4. Check editor markers: `editor.getMarkers()` returns `[TextEditorMarker]` in v1.8 but `[]` in v1.9

I’m using this feature in https://github.com/livestyle/atom#livestyle-analyzer
I’m marking underlying buffer directly with analysis data to make it available for every opened editor for the same buffer.

data.title: Question: Does atom have unit tests for its code base?
data.body:
Does atom have unit tests for its code base? If so, how may I run them?

Thanks

data.title: Don't throw an error when $ATOM_HOME does not exist
data.body:
This was introduced in #12246 as a result of the `.coffee` -> `.js` conversion of `main-process/main.js`. An exception we were suppressing in Coffeescript via its `try` (without `catch`, which means is implicit) is now being thrown again, causing Atom to not start when the `$ATOM_HOME` folder doesn't exist.

Fixes #12283.

/cc: @atom/core

data.title: find in current directory does not work, always showing "no result"
data.body:
Hello everyone,

On Windows 7 and with Atom 1.10.0-beta0, I try to find text in the current directory of a file with Alt-a, project-find:show-in-current-directory. The file is not in any project. Regardless of what I try to find, Atom shows "no result". 

To reproduce, I did:
1. Create empty %userprofile%.atom
2. Download and install Atom 1.10.0-beta0
3. Start it with 'atom --safe'
4. Open any text file
5. In the tree view, delete the project that was created when the file was opened (because I would like to search in the file's current directory, independent of any project)
6. Alt-a. The dialog pre-populates with the absolute path to the directory of the file
7. Enter search text and press 'enter'

Expected: list of occurrences
Actual: "no result"
